subtasks: Walk through the raised bed and identify peanut plants
Gently dig up a peanut plant using hands or a fork
Inspect the roots for peanuts and remove them, shaking off excess dirt
Check the maturity of peanuts by breaking open a pod
Collect immature or mature peanuts in a basket for personal consumption or animal treats
Separate and set aside weeds and other plant debris along with uprooted plants
Transfer harvested peanuts to a cleaning area for further processing
Cure or roast peanuts immediately after harvest based on intended usage
Prepare the raised bed for future planting by removing weeds, adding topsoil, and integrating decomposed plants
Implement crop rotation strategies for sustainable peanut cultivation
Gather plant tops from harvested peanut beds
Transport the plant tops to the animal enclosure
Distribute the tops as a treat or supplemental feed to poultry (ducks, turkeys, chickens)
Monitor animal reaction and adjust feeding methods accordingly
Observe and document butterfly activity in sunflower fields
Assess sunflower plant health and seed pod development
Consider harvesting mature sunflower seeds for seed saving or replanting
Address sunflower invasiveness by practicing selective cultivation or managed growth
